projectPurpose: To provide a pure Rust library for reading standard ZIP and ZIP64 archive formats.

alternatives.name: zip (Rust crate)
alternatives.license: Open Source (likely MIT or Apache 2.0, typical for Rust)
mainFeatures: Supports reading and writing ZIP files
Supports various compression methods (deflate, bzip2, zstd, lzma, xz)

alternatives.name: libzip
mainFeatures: C library for reading, creating, modifying ZIP archives
Supports various compression methods (deflate, bzip2, LZMA, zstd)
Supports Winzip AES and legacy PKWARE encryption

alternatives.name: 7-Zip
mainFeatures: High compression ratio, especially in 7z format
Supports packing/unpacking many formats including ZIP

marketPositioning: rc-zip is positioned as a focused, pure Rust library specifically for reading ZIP and ZIP64 archives. Unlike broader archiving tools or libraries that offer both reading and writing, or those that wrap C libraries, rc-zip emphasizes a native Rust implementation for the reading task. This pure-Rust approach may appeal to developers prioritizing code safety, control, or specific performance characteristics within the Rust ecosystem for large ZIP file consumption, rather than general-purpose archiving or creation.
